dmp.title: COVID-19 Gold Price Analysis
dmp.description: The current global Corona crisis not only has a huge impact on health systems around the world, but also on the economic situation. Gold is traditionally known to be a go-to asset in times of crisis and uncertainty and its price therefore usually increases when stock indices collapse. However, the Austrian newspaper Kurier recently published an article (https://kurier.at/wirtschaft/coronavirus-verliert-gold-seinen-ruf-als-krisenwaehrung/400787762) claiming that current market activity during the Corona crisis contradicts this theory. They also state that the gold price will stabilize again in the medium term as this also happened on other occasions. This experiment aims at a data-driven approach to make validations of these assumptions easier. The development of the number of Corona cases and deaths in each country over time is compared to the corresponding gold prices. Since we have not yet overcome the current situation, validating assumptions about medium-term consequences on the gold price cannot be made now, but might be with future data.

project.title: Data Stewardship UE SS 2020 - Exercise 1
project.description: This maDMP is created as an exercise for the Data Stewardship course at TU Wien.

dataset.title: Python scripts
dataset.description: These scripts perform the analysis and produce the output.

dataset.title: COVID-19 cases and deaths
dataset.description: Raw data about global COVID-19 infections and deaths

dataset.title: Gold prices
dataset.description: Raw data about the daily Gold price at FXCM market place

dataset.title: Correlation of COVID-19 cases and the gold price
dataset.description: Computed data about the correlation of COVID-19 cases and the gold price

distribution.title: Correlation of COVID-19 cases and the gold price
